title: Unrest follows US police acquittal
description: US police say they have made multiple arrests in protests in Cleveland after an officer was cleared over the fatal shooting of an unarmed black couple.

title: 'Beautiful Mind' mathematician killed
description: Renowned mathematician John Nash, subject of the film A Beautiful Mind, dies in a New Jersey taxi crash with his wife.

title: US Senate blocks surveillance bill
description: The US Senate blocks a bill that would have ended bulk collection of phone records by the National Security Agency.

title: California farmers agree water deal
description: California regulators accept an offer from farmers to reduce water usage by 25% in an effort to avoid deeper cuts in the state's battle with drought.

title: DC mansion murder suspect arrested
description: Daron Dylon Wint, who had previously worked for the victims' family business, was captured late Thursday in Washington DC.

title: US reality show taken off schedule
description: A US cable network pulls a long running reality TV show over allegations of sexual abuse by one of its members.

title: First set of Clinton emails released
description: State Department releases hundreds of emails - many relating to the attack in Benghazi, Libya - from Hillary Clinton's private email account.

title: 'Success kid' raises cash for dad
description: Sam Griner, whose image spawned the 'success kid' meme, is using his fame to raise cash to pay for medical treatment for his father.

title: Tribeca festival begins in New York
description: New York's Tribeca Film Festival kicked off on Wednesday with the world premiere of Saturday Night Live documentary, Live from New York!.

title: Huge audience for Letterman finale
description: After a 33-year career, The Tonight Show host David Letterman's goodbye attracts more than 13 million viewers

title: VIDEO: US policeman cleared over deaths
description: A US police officer who climbed onto the hood of a car and fired repeatedly at its unarmed occupants has been acquitted of manslaughter charges.

title: VIDEO: World's oldest woman turns 116
description: An American woman, said to be the oldest person in the world, is celebrating her 116th birthday on Saturday.

title: VIDEO: The view from One World Trade Center
description: The observatory of New York's One World Trade Center, which was built on the site of the twin towers destroyed in the 9/11 attacks, opens for visitors this month.

title: VIDEO: Letterman's final Late Show goodbye
description: David Letterman has presented his last edition of his late night talk show.

title: VIDEO: California oil spill spans nine miles
description: Two oil slicks, stretching nine miles, have formed off the coast of southern California in the US, after an onshore pipeline ruptured.

title: VIDEO: Closing the tech gender gap
description: In Silicon Valley men traditionally dominate, but all-women projects to help support and mentor entrepreneurs are having an impact.

title: VIDEO: Biker shoot-out: 'I hid in freezer'
description: Texas police say 170 people are to face organised crime charges after a bike-gang shooting that left nine people dead and 18 others injured.

title: VIDEO: California drought: Farms v homes
description: California is in the midst of a long drought and it does not have enough water.

title: VIDEO: Making art underground
description: The DuPont Underground in Washington pitches a new way to experience art underground but will the project get off the ground? The BBC's Olivia Crellin reports.

title: Ben Carson wins Oklahoma straw poll
description: Republican activists give non-politician Ben Carson a boost after listening to Republican presidential hopefuls for three days.

title: McDonald's faces worker protests
description: Thousands of workers and union supporters protest outside McDonald's headquarters, as the fast food firm continues to face wage pressure.

title: Target beats earnings forecasts
description: US retail giant Target reports a 52% increase in quarterly profits, helped by a boost from online sales.

title: Canada country profile
description: Provides an overview of Canada, including key events and facts about the world's second-largest country

title: Puerto Rico profile
description: Provides and overview as well as facts and figures for this small dependency of the United States situated in the Caribbean

title: St Pierre and Miquelon profile
description: Provides an overview of what remains of France's once-extensive possessions in North America

title: United States country profile
description: Provides an overview of the United States, including key events and facts about this superpower

title: VIDEO: Composing an urban masterpiece
description: Composing an urban masterpiece

title: Can California learn to live with drought?
description: Can California learn to live with drought?

title: The element that made the 20th Century shine
description: The element that made the modern era gleam

title: Does a death sentence always mean death?
description: Does a death sentence always mean death?

title: The mother who 'outed' her daughter's Facebook lie
description: Was it right for mother to publicly scold her teenage daughter?

title: The US police chief fighting racism
description: Could this man solve the US policing crisis?
